org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin7

Annotation Type ProvidesProperty


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value={METHOD,FIELD})
@Documented
public @interface ProvidesProperty
    Annotates a Java field or method that provides a read-only Vaadin Property value.

    This annotation indicates that a read-only Vaadin Property having the specified name and type derived from the annotated field or zero-argument method is accessible by reading that field or method.

    Classes with @ProvidesProperty-annotated fields and methods can be used to automatically generate a PropertyExtractor and a list of PropertyDefs by using a PropertyReader.

    The Container classes in this package that are configured with a PropertyExtractor and a list of PropertyDefs all have a constructor variant taking a @ProvidesProperty-annotated Java class, which allows the container properties to be auto-detected via introspection.

    Some details regarding @ProvidesProperty annotations on methods:

    • Only non-void methods taking zero parameters are supported; @ProvidesProperty annotations on other methods are ignored
    • @ProvidesProperty annotations on interface methods are supported
    • If a method and the superclass or superinterface method it overrides are both annotated with @ProvidesProperty, but the annotations declare different properties (i.e., they have different names), then two properties will be defined with the same value
    • After introspection, all property names must be unique, with the exception that a method may redundantly declare the same property (i.e., having the same name) as any method it overrides.

    See Also:
    PropertyReader

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String value
      Get the name of the Vaadin property.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        Get the name of the Vaadin property. If this is left unset (empty string), then the name of the annotated field, or the bean property name of the annotated "getter" method is used.
        Default:
        ""
